text: A laborer brought his pack of oxen to the watering hole. I was walking around near a hungry wolf looking for food. The wolf found the plow and began to lick the edges of the yoke, and immediately and unknowingly ended up putting his head inside. Waving as hard as he could to free himself, he dragged the plough along the groove. And the farmer came and saw him in this business, and said to him, Ah, thief wolf! if it were true that thou hast forsaken thy trade, and hast joined the field to work fairly! Sometimes the wicked seem to act well, but it's pure illusion.
title: El lobo y el labrador
author: nan Esopo
